summary: Tweaks the Healing Poltice of Requiem.
descriptionHtml:
About
=====
I’ve always liked the concept of the Healing Poultice in Requiem. However, I often found myself in trouble of finding sufficient amounts of crafting materials (especially ale) and ended up either using far more healing potions or leveling alchemy with characters I usually wouldn’t. Thus, I’ve decided to tinker with the poultice and share the tiny result with anyone who might be interested.
 
What it does
===========
- [size=2]The crafting recipe has been changed.[/size] 
   Now you will need: [color=#6aa84f]1[/color]x [i][color=#1e84cc][Any Wine][/color][/i], [color=#6aa84f]1[/color]x [i][color=#1e84cc]Tundra Cotton[/color][/i], [color=#6aa84f]2[/color]x [i][color=#1e84cc]Blue Mountain Flowers[/color][/i].
- The strength of the poultice is determined by the type of wine used. Stronger wine leads to faster regeneration, although the overall process is still
  fairly slow and close to the original.

   [i]Wine, Spiced Wine[/i]          -->  1.0x original regeneration per second
   [i]Alto Wine [/i]                      -->  1.2x original regeneration per second
   [i]Emberbrand Wine[/i]            -->  1.4x original regeneration per second
  [i] Surille Brothers Wine[/i]       -->  1.6x original regeneration per second
  [i] Argonian Blood Wine [/i]      -->  1.8x original regeneration per second
   [i]Firebrand Wine[/i]               -->  2.0x original regeneration per second
 
 [color=#f9cb9c]  [/color][i][color=#f9cb9c]The poultice only shows up in the crafting menu if you have any of the above mentioned wine in your inventory, preventing overcluttered crafting
   menues. Also, you still need to read the original crafting recipe note (which has been slightly altered to blend with the changes).[/color]
[/i]
-  The poultice model has been changed to a linen pouch.
-  The weight has been reduced to 0.2 on all versions and the value decreased depending on the quality of the poultice, ranging from 10 – 35 Septims.
-  [color=#6aa84f]Optional: [/color]features a relocation from the Tanning Rack to the Campfire Crafting menu.

Requirements
============
Dragonborn DLC
Hearthfire DLC
Requiem
Campfire[i] (optional)[/i]
